Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_8_7: Hm? Oh, that's Startorch Academy, where we're heading. Pretty amazing, huh?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_8_8: It's... far beyond what I had imagined.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_8_9: Didn't get to introduce myself. I'm Lynae, by the way.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_8_10: I saw your acceptance letter, so... freshman? What's your name?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_8_13: It's not totally safe yet. Let's keep moving while we talk.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_8_14:
As a Voidworm chases you relentlessly, a blonde girl appears. Working together, you bring down falling rocks to slow the creature and make your escape.
Your motorbike bursts out of the cave into the vast, open view of Lahai-Roi. The girl introduces herself as Lynae, and together, you continue toward Startorch Academy.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_9_1: You sure you're alright? I wasn't exactly going slow back there, but you don't seem fazed at all.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_9_2: Ugh, sorry. I mean, your reflexes are impressive. You reacted fast.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_9_3: I'm fine. Your brakes kicked in just in time.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_901_1: By the way, Lahai-Roi's right in the middle of a Void Storm surge right now. How'd you even get here?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_901_2: I used a few... unconventional methods.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_901_3: Unconventional methods, huh? That reminds me, just a few days ago, a student named Chisa appeared out of thin air in the middle of a class. Freaked everyone out.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_901_4: And you know what? She's the same student who went missing twenty years ago! People are already calling it Startorch's Eighth Great Mystery.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_901_5: Don't tell me you're another case? Well, if so, that'd make you the Ninth Great Mystery.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_315_1: There! The Defense Array is right ahead! Watch out, it might strike from below!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_317_2: Professor Mornye, can you hear me?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_317_3: Ugh... Signal's dead. Either too much Void Storm interference, or we're too far from the Institute.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_317_4: That sound... It's attacking the array?!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_317_5: Figures. The activation pulse must've drawn it in. We need to find another way…
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_317_6: Yeah. Plus, I can feel that fat worm zeroing in on our frequency.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_317_8: Okay, I'll draw it away. The other arrays are yours!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_317_11: It's not my first time racing a Voidworm!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_317_12: After the first defensive array activates, Lynae suggests you split up to activate the others faster. She will draw the Voidworm's attention while you activate the remaining arrays.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_318_2: (Just stay on me. Keep away from the arrays. Give {Male=him;Female=her} the time {Male=he;Female=she} needs.)
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_318_7: Stay where you are! Keep your eyes on me!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_318_8: (Hah, this device is burning through my Resonance energy faster than I thought.)
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_319_2: The second array just got activated. {PlayerName}...
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_319_3: The device is at its limit. Damn it, the Voidworm's heading {Male=his;Female=her} way!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_320_2: Hold on, that worm's scent feels like it's getting closer.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_320_4: Can't leave Lynae holding it off for long.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_321_5: I won't keep you waiting long.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_322_4: I've got this! Go ahead and activate the Defense Array!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_323_1: The Voidworm has contaminated these security mechs too.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_323_2: No time to waste. I'll take them out.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_324_1: The Defense Array is online! The Voidworm is now restrained!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_324_2: See those things on its head? They're its Voidmatter Regulators. Take 'em all out, and we'll fry this worm!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_324_3: It's too far to hit from here. We'll have to climb onto it.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_325_2: Keep up! We gotta close the gap between attacks!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_325_3: It's about to strike! Find cover!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_47_3: Hehe. Before I knew it, I was already in deep...
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_47_5: Yeah... just burned a chunk of power patching the barrier. Don't worry. Didn't come close to Overclocking.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_47_7: We draw the Voidworm to the Defense Array and trap it there.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_47_8: Mornye sent me the coordinates and override codes.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_47_9: Copy that. I'll keep the device running hot.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_47_10: Keep driving! I've got the Voidworm in my sights!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_202_1: ({Male=He;Female=She} should've made it to the Institute by now. No danger there... I'll handle this without dragging {Male=him;Female=her} into it.)
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_202_2: (That message I just got... It's from the Fractsidus "liaison.")
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_202_3: (The Void Storm should've erased him… Yet here I am getting a message from a "dead" man.)
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_202_4: (Someone's using his comms ID. They know what I did, but haven't blown my cover. A threat? Or something else?)
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_202_8: Lynae receives a message from a "liaison" who should be dead. Tracing the signal to its final location, she encounters contaminated Exoswarm.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_203_1: This kind of aggression… Have these Exoswarm been altered?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_203_2: The Fractsidus must be behind it...
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_205_2: If you think this'll slow me down, you're in for a disappointment.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_206_1: You got here quicker than I expected. No hurry. We've got time before the main event.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_206_6: It's all up to you, Lynae—who you choose to be, and what you're willing to lose.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_206_8: That look… Still unsure, I see. I could help you out a little.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_206_9: Spare me. Whatever you're planning, I'll stop it.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_206_10: Oh? So the "Nameless Fugitive" is now the "Unseen Guardian"?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_206_11: Turn me in, and the Spacetrek Collective will come for you, too. Tell me, Lynae, are you really as resolute as you think?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_206_12: Either way, you're a problem for me. So here's a parting gift... one fitting for your new role.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_206_13: The same gift you've always received—"doubt" and "isolation."
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_206_14:
She follows the trail and finds the Fractsidus liaison holding a strange device in front of the Hyvatia Detector. He mocks her for wavering between "fugitive" and "guardian," claiming her indecision has caused him trouble. Threatening to expose her identity, he forces her to choose a side.
As Lynae refuses, he activates the device, corrupting the Hyvatia Detector and escaping.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_21_2: How do you feel? Settling in alright?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_21_3: Not bad. The wind feels nice.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_21_4: You've been flirting with the speed limit all ride...
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_21_6: Heh, I'll take that as a compliment on my driving skills…
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_21_7: But honestly, it's been ages since I last raced with someone else. Getting to take you for a ride like this? Makes my day!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_21_9: Uh-huh. The roar of the engine, wind in my face... It's like I've got my destination and I'm the one calling the shots.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_21_10: Look... Lahai-Roi's sky might be artificial, but I found more freedom under it than I've ever known anywhere else.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_21_12: Yeah. I mean, you've only got one life, right? Might as well live it the way you want. When to brake, hit the gas. Hell, even the paint job of your ride. Doesn't matter if you're a normie or a Resonator, everyone should have that choice.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_21_13: That's what Startorch Academy is to me. Before I came here, I never imagined a place like this could exist. Full of people so pure, so driven...
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_21_14: With the resolve to burn in the search for answers. With the belief they can actually end the Void Storm and the Threnodian... and maybe break through the Etheric Sea to find what true freedom really looks like.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_21_16: Watching them chase their dreams… It's hard not to want that for yourself.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_21_17: But you're already a student here. You have what it takes to chase your dreams too.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_21_19: …But I've gotta say, things are plenty good enough right now.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_21_21: Welcome! You're now officially a Startorch Academy student!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_21_22: My first introduction was too rushed, so I'm doing it properly this time. I'm Lynae, a second-year in the Preparatory Program.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_21_24: Time flies. Feels like I just got here, and now I'm a second-year. Hehe, you could call me Miss Lynae, if you want.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_21_25: Well then, pleased to meet you... Miss Lynae?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_21_27: Maybe just stick with Lynae, haha. Not really used to the whole formality thing.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_21_28: All right, let's get moving! Time to hit the road!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_21_29: Taking a short break on the roadside, you both admire Lahai-Roi's scenery. Lynae remarks that although the sky is artificial, she's found more freedom under it than anywhere else.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_23_4: Not really. Just… on the way here, I thought I saw more Void Storm zones than usual. Makes you wonder.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_23_5: But that's not for me to worry about. Priority's getting your Cassette burned.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_23_7: See that floating structure along the track? That's the Spacetrek Collective. From here, you can take the Startorch Express straight inside.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_23_8: Like the trains we saw earlier?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_23_9: Yep. They connect Lahai-Roi to the surface frostlands. But with all these Void Storms, surface trips—except for supply runs—are on hold. Every train turns back here once it reaches the Institute.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_23_10: Well, my mission's done. Once you're inside, someone will take you to the Cassette burning room.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_23_11: If you have questions, find Professor Mornye. She looks aloof, but trust me, she's cool. And she's one of the few willing to race me.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_23_12: I'd love to stick around, but I can't skip another afternoon class.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_23_13: No worries. Thanks for bringing me here.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_23_14: So I was just your excuse to skip class?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_23_15: Don't sweat it. It's the right thing to do. When I first arrived, the seniors showed me the ropes, just like this.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_23_16: No! I'm not the type to bail on someone after crashing into them, after all.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_23_17: Go on! When you're done, I'll give you a tour of the campus.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_23_18: Well, time to take care of my own business.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_23_19:
After seeing the incident in the tunnel, Lynae seems preoccupied. She leads you to the station below the Research Institute and tells you that the Startorch Express will take you straight there. She wants to join you, but absolutely cannot skip her afternoon class. After parting with her, you board the train alone.
Watching from afar, Lynae's expression turns cold. "...Time to take care of my own business.'
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_24_1: ...<te href=700017>Helios</te> parameters… stable. Huh, Void Storm readings spiking again? Oh, no, that's yesterday's report. Ugh, my head... my brain's turning to data soup.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_24_2: Excuse me, about the Cassette burning...
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_24_3: Of course… This should lower the margin of error to the minimum… Oh, sorry? Cassette?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_24_4: Cassette Depository is just through the portal over there.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_24_5: Oh no, what was that verification method I just thought of...
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_2501_1: Cassette Depository Access and Operation Protocols
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_2501_2: Access Warning: This server group archives recovered Rabelle Cassette frequency data. This is a restricted area.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_2501_3: All visitors and temporary staff require prior approval and must be escorted by the security supervisor. The security system conducts mandatory frequency scans on all personnel. Unauthorized entry will trigger the alarm.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_2501_4: The possession of any unauthorized recording, transmission, or data collection devices is strictly prohibited.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_2501_5: All staff must perform routine checks on the physical connection integrity and frequency stability of memory storage servers. Any equipment malfunction or abnormal environmental readings must be reported immediately to the facility maintenance department.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_26_1: This is the torch of civilization and the future. Chin up. One day, we'll touch the Etheric Sea… and the universe beyond.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_26_2: *Bzzt*—Leave it to me. When you come back—*Bzzt*—
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_26_3: Data's running slow. Just five more minutes. I'll stay. Get the students out first!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_26_4: The cafeteria menu's not bad this week. What do you say we...
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_26_6: Those are just the server racks for the Cassette frequency data.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_26_7: Stop resonating with them. At this rate, you'll trigger an overload.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_26_10: …Yes, this is our first meeting. I'm Mornye. Spacetrek Collective researcher and professor at Startorch Academy.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_26_12: Hm? Do I not look the part?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_26_13: You came to burn your Cassette, right? I'll take you.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_26_14: I haven't introduced myself yet. I'm {PlayerName}.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_26_17: You enter the Cassette Depository and accidentally activate a memory server. Amid the data of the deceased appears a researcher named Mornye. She stabilizes your overloaded frequency and calmly guides you to the burning room, though you catch a brief, fleeting look of shock in her eyes when she first sees you.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_27_2: Recollections. Recollections of past Spacetrek researchers, staff, and students.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_27_4: Data stored in the Cassettes. More precisely, memories. They're crucial to the continuity of self-aware consciousness. It's what makes us truly "human."
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_27_5: Lahai-Roi is constantly shrouded in the Void Storm, a byproduct of the Voidborne Threnodian. It has the power to disintegrate the frequency of any living being.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_27_6: To counter this, the Institute produced Cassettes, devices designed to capture and preserve a person's frequency and memories, safeguarding their very existence.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_27_7: The Cassettes of the deceased are kept here.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_27_8: Then why did they suddenly start playing?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_27_9: You likely resonated with one of the stored frequencies.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_27_11: Anyway. For now, let's get you to the burning room.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_28_2: (Those were… my memories? But the last one…)
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_28_4: ...No, I'm fine. So, this is a <te href=700006>Rabelle Cassette</te>?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_28_5: Yes. Your frequency has been copied and transcribed into it.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_28_6: But before it can be put into service, it needs calibration. Would you hand it over for a moment?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_28_7: Hm? So that noise earlier wasn't an error. This frequency code… I've seen the exact same one in the database.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_28_9: Identical codes caused a conflict during transcribing. Normally, Resonators from similar origins have close matches. But a perfect match? That's almost unheard of.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_28_10: And stranger still, it's not in any official archive. The file is… empty.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_28_11: Are you sure nothing else is in there?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_28_14: Just some unreadable data. Not corruption. More like… someone deleted it.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_28_17: (Could it have been me who left it behind? But if I deleted it myself… why leave any trace?)
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_28_18: Just a data error. Overwriting should solve it.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_28_20: This <te href=700007>Frequency Cassette Recorder</te>, or FCR, will alert you when a Void Storm appears. It also dampens the effects of the Storm and stabilizes your existence here in Lahai-Roi.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_28_21: So keep it on you at all times.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_28_23: But without adequate precautions, it still won't fully protect you from the Void Storm's effects. Many surveyors and students have had their frequencies erased this way.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_28_25: …Mm, I have read your report. You're stable for now. Compared to your enrollment check-up, your Rabelle's Curve has leveled out. But yes, your frequency still shows signs of past loss.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_28_26: As for the Voidworm, there's no precedent... No one's ever survived having their frequency devoured. Whether yours can be restored is unknown.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_28_27: So don't take unnecessary risks. That's rule number one.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_28_28: I came here to find out what happened to my frequency.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_28_29: I don't know much about this place yet.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_28_30: I understand. I'll keep watch for anything that might help.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_28_31: Ask me anything you need to know.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_28_32:
After the burning is complete, Mornye discovers your frequency code matches a deleted, anonymous entry in the database.
Mornye hands you the finished Cassette tape, explaining that it serves as your ID and a Terminal that warns of Void Storms. These storms disintegrate the frequencies of any living thing they touch, and the Cassette can slow that effect to some extent. As for recovering the frequency you've already lost, she cannot make any promises.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_2801_1: Professor Mornye! Where are you? If possible, please return at once! Ahhh, Dr. Anslem, please calm down!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_2801_3: It's about the <te href=700010>artificial sun's</te> launch process. The professors are arguing again...
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_2801_4: That's the second time this month.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_2801_5: We can't get a word in. We need you here…
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_2801_6: …Not that my being there will help.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_2801_7: I'll be there shortly. And you... Remember to breathe.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_2801_8: Sorry. There's an urgent matter I need to attend to.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_2801_9: It's fine. I'll head back now then.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_2801_10: I could wait for you here.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_2801_11: Oh, there's no need to shy away. If you're free, you can accompany me.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_2801_12: The Research Institute is open to Startorch students. Walking around here might give you some useful insights.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_2801_13: A sudden call interrupts the conversation: two professors are arguing over the artificial sun's launch procedure, and Mornye is urgently needed. You follow her to the Artificial Sun Lab.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_2802_1: Burning protocol initiated. Resonance link confirmed. Burning in five, four, three…
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_2802_2: During the burning process, your memories materialize as data projections. You see everything you've experienced since arriving in Solaris, along with scenes you don't recall, scenes featuring Mornye.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_30_1: That artificial sun they spoke of...
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_30_2: In simple terms, it's our plan to replace the "sun" you see in the sky.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_30_3: You're planning to replace the Exostrider's Drive? Is that what the New Solar Ceremony is about?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_30_4: You remember...? Did the Black Shores tell you this?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_30_5: It's the talk of the Academy now.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_30_6: Right. Replacing it is critical to reactivating the Exostrider. And really, we can't stay wrapped in its warm light forever.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_30_7: How far along is the research on the Exostrider? How much do we really know?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_30_9: More than you'd expect... fellow researcher.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_30_10: I'll show you the details once we are in the lab.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_308_1: See that? That's the lift to the surface. We call it the Starward Riseway.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_308_2: It was built alongside the giant sword left behind by the Exostrider and is one of the most important structures in Lahai-Roi.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_308_3: The Research Institute is right at the top.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_309_1: Ahem… So, the scattered mech components of the Exostrider eventually turned into "creatures." Those Exoswarm we've been seeing along the way.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_309_2: They're part of what makes Lahai-Roi's ecosystem so unique. For example, the ones living in the underground rivers—
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_309_3: ...It kind of feels like you're reciting a textbook.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_309_5: Mm, pretty sure I nailed that one.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_31_1: Almost there. Hope they've reached a consensus.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_310_2: Keeping up with me like this... You're pretty good at driving, aren't you?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_310_4: Ah, here it comes! One of my favorite tunnels! Stay close!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_312_1: Attention: All outbound trains to the surface are temporarily suspended. For assistance, please contact station staff.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_312_2: Due to an unexpected incident along the route ahead, trains to Startorch Academy are expected to be delayed by 45 minutes...
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_313_1: Attention: The upper transfer gate will close in 10… 9… 8… 7—
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_313_2: Like Mornye said, the Hyvatia Detector is critical for the New Solar Ceremony. For it to malfunction at a time like this…
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_32_1: Professor Mornye! What a relief to see you—
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_32_4: I appreciate your perspective, Professor Anslem.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_32_5: But according to Royan calculations, this launch window is the best we've had in decades.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_32_6: How can you be so certain, Warren? Their "optimal window" is derived from those indecipherable runes, with no methodology disclosed. Even our most advanced computational systems have failed to decipher their process!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_32_7: The Roya are our partners, Professor.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_32_8: Their calculations are unquestionable. All we can do is uphold our side of the bargain and make sure the New Solar Ceremony goes off without a hitch.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_32_9: Well then... I believe counsel from a third person may serve us well at this point.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_32_10: I'm inclined to proceed with the original plan.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_32_11: But given the unsatisfying results from the last simulation, I understand Professor Anslem's concerns. I'll go to Bjartr Woods to consult with the Heliodic Six and reverify the parameters.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_32_12: What matters now is ensuring that the Institute can calculate and calibrate the Reactor Drive's data in time for the launch of the new sun.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_32_13: We all know the importance of <te href=700013>Hyvatia</te> in this process, and I sincerely hope you'll place more trust in it, Anslem.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_32_14: This is a shared achievement between the Collective and the Roya, the very future of Lahai-Roi. I respect your caution and the pride you take in your work. But please, don't let past failures hold you back now.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_32_15: Hmph, fine words… Just don't forget that I warned you.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_32_16: In the Artificial Sun Lab, Researchers Warren and Anslem are in a heated dispute. Warren supports following the Roya's predicted launch window for the New Solar Ceremony, while Anslem refuses to trust their calculations. Mornye mediates, siding with the original plan. Warren stresses that the Hyvatia Detector's measurements are critical, and Anselm leaves after issuing a warning.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_3201_16: Sorry if I'm being blunt. I'm sure Professor Mornye has her reasons for bringing someone into the lab.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_3201_17: But I recognize every face here, except yours. Mind telling me who you are?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_3201_19: Ah, so you're here to record your Cassette? Though, with the Void Storm in full force…
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_3201_20: {Male=He;Female=She} comes recommended by the Black Shores.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_3201_22: So you came here by the same means as Miss Chisa, correct?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_3201_23: Her sudden appearance in the Academy caused quite a stir that day. Would you mind sharing how you made it here?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_3201_24: I don't deal with the Academy all that much. All I heard was that someone appeared out of nowhere outside the gates.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_3201_25: This may not be the right time for such questions, Professor Warren.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_3201_26: Oh... forgive me. Curiosity has always been my second nature.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_3201_27: Well, if you have the Black Shores' recommendation, you're certainly a student here.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_3201_28: Allow me to introduce myself: I'm Warren, supervisor of this lab.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_3201_29: Aside from the rooms marked "No Entry," the rest of the facility is open for student visits.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_3201_30: I'm sure Professor Mornye will give you a thorough tour, but please don't take too long. A key member like her needs to focus on our project.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_3201_31: Alas, my work calls. I'll leave you two to it.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_3202_32: Sorry you had to witness their quarrel.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_3202_33: Anyway, just like Professor Warren said, feel free to look around as you like.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_33_1: That last proposal... can we even make the final testing window? Isn't it a bit too conservative?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_33_2: But Professor Anslem just said it was too radical. He told me to revise it again.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_33_3: Ugh... Fine. I'll go refine the backup plan on my end. There are still a few data points I need to recalculate.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_3302_1: Massive cultivation tanks house many ancient plant species you've never seen on the surface. Life was once scarce in these underground caverns, until the Reactor Drive ignited here. In its relentless pursuit of progress, the Spacetrek Collective did not forget to retrieve the dormant seeds that slept beneath the Roya Frostlands.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_3302_2: "From a single drop of water, a single seed, a single torch... life will find its way."
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_332_1: Phew... That was a close call. I'd better report that mess back to the Academy.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_332_3: Yeah… But it's still kinda weird. Normally, the maintenance bots clear stuff up pretty quick.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_333_1: Phew... That was a close call. I'd better report that mess back to the Academy.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_333_2: Does this sort of thing happen often?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_333_3: Yeah… But it's still kinda weird. Normally, the maintenance bots clear stuff up pretty quick.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_333_4: But seriously, your driving's amazing! You were smooth as butter dodging all that!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_334_1: Whoa, look! The train caught up to us...
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_335_1: The Academy's got a special barrier to handle the Void Storm. Normally, it's only half-active.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_335_2: …If you ever see it fully powered up, that means we're in serious trouble.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_337_1: Let's roll! Hehe, and hey, this way I get to take you for a joyride.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_35_1: Void Storm detected near Sundermere... Readings rising rapidly!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_35_2: The source is... the Hyvatia Detector?!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_35_5: Yes, Professor. Hyvatia's been compromised by the Void Storm. It's gone rogue. The Defense Array is activating...
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_35_6: Their target is... the Institute itself.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_35_9: The Void Storm has corrupted the Hyvatia Detector, a critical sensor for the Reactor Drive. It's off course and now targeting us.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_35_10: A surface detector built by the Spacetrek Collective for the Reactor Drive's inspection and maintenance. It's vital for the Ceremony's data calibration. And now, at the worst possible time…
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_35_11: Wait, someone's near the Detector! Is that… a student?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_35_16: What?! I never authorized this command… Ugh, I can't stop it!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_35_18: Hyvatia's contamination triggered the highest-level safety protocol. We'll all be sealed in here until the threat is neutralized.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_35_19: I tried to stop it… but my access has been denied.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_35_20: Then we need to find a way to get out there.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_35_23: Wait, the main train's suspended under lockdown protocol!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_35_24: Professor Mornye, I need to borrow an Institute vehicle.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_35_25: We have backup vehicles at the transfer gate. But how do you plan to reach it?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_35_26: The same way I got in!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_35_27: Now that you're caught up, may I ask you a question?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_35_29: Would you like to attend the New Solar Ceremony?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_35_30: Me? But... I'm just a freshman.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_35_32: I… I'd want you there to witness it. The rise of the new sun, and humanity taking their first steps into the future they've built with their own hands.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_35_33: Since you put it that way...
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_35_35: I'd be honored to witness the rise of Lahai-Roi's new sun.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_35_37:
Mornye invites you to join the ceremony, and smiles when you agree. At that moment, a Void Storm corrupts Hyvatia and triggers it to lose control. It now targets the Institute itself. On the surveillance feed, you see Lynae, who was supposedly in class, standing before it.
The crisis looms. You race off on your motorbike.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_36_1: Watch out! You have to go!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_3601_1: How did... Never mind. Now's not the time for questions. Careful, Hyvatia's gone haywire. We need to stop it before it reaches the Academy!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_3602_1: See that spot? That's its weak point! ...Watch out for its attacks! I'll handle things here!
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_37_1: Barely made it. Thanks for the help.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_37_5: Seal off the area immediately. Pull the system logs and report all damages to the Institute. Check the Reactor Drive as well. We need to raise our security levels.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_37_6: If I recall correctly, you're supposed to be in class, Miss Lynae. Why are you here?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_37_9: Quiet. I'm asking her, not you.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_37_10: I... I noticed that Hyvatia was out of control, so I tried to stop it.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_37_11: A malfunction in the Institute's primary Detector is no small matter for a student to handle. You should have notified the Academy or the Institute immediately, not thrown yourself into danger alone.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_37_12: I just acted before I could think.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_37_13: Acted before you could think? Regardless of your circumstance, if you can't provide a reasonable explanation, we've reason to believe you're involved in this "incident", directly or indirectly.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_37_14: Its malfunction had nothing to do with me.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_37_15: Denial won't get you anywhere. If you don't tell us exactly what happened, I'll have no choice but to expel you under the Academy's confidentiality clause.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_37_16: Do you even remember what Startorch stands for, Miss Lynae? What our mission is?
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_37_18: Ah, {PlayerName}... Didn't expect to see you again so soon. You must be feeling unsettled after such an incident on your first day.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_37_19: Of course, I don't mean to put the blame on a student, but her actions clearly violated Academy regulations.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_37_20: (Lynae's behavior is suspicious… but judging by what I just saw, she didn't seem like she was trying to damage the Detector.)
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_37_22: (There must be another reason. Besides… it seemed she was about to tell me something before.)
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_37_23: It was Lynae who protected me from Hyvatia's attack.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_37_24: If she were the culprit, she could've slipped away in the chaos, but she didn't. She worked with me to contain the damage.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_37_25: Until we know the cause for certain, punishing her is... premature.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_37_26: My apologies for the tone. But we must inform the Academy and investigate every possible angle behind this.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_37_28: The Institute has poured everything into this Ceremony. If something has gone wrong, we need to uncover who is responsible. Miss Lynae, please come with me. We'll address this with the faculty.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_37_29: And as a witness to the incident, I'm afraid you'll need to come as well, {PlayerName}.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_37_32:
You and Lynae work together to stop Hyvatia's rampage. When you ask why she was there, she hesitates to explain.
Warren arrives and is horrified by the damage. He demands to know why she was at the Institute during class hours and suspects her involvement. Lynae remains silent, as if holding something back.
Just as she prepares to use her Forte to escape, you intervene. You point out that she helped prevent a catastrophe and had no motive for sabotage, calling Warren's accusation premature. Ultimately, he orders you both back to the Academy for a formal investigation.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_325_9: Nothing. Just didn't think I'd get to actually ride a Voidworm.
Main_LahaiRoi_3_1_325_10: This Academy life has sure been one hell of a trip.
